product_name: Hot ToolsPro Artist Nano Ceramic Curling Irons For Smooth, Shiny Hair
summary: SummaryIf you love curls, coils, and waves of all shapes, youâ€™ll flip for this curling iron + wand. It makes styling your hair a breeze. Advanced Nano Ceramic technology helps create sleek, glossy shine, and reduce frizz. Whatâ€™s more thereâ€™s no stick hair glides effortlessly.
details: DetailsBenefitsNano Ceramic: Helps create sleek, glossy shine, and reduce frizz. Whatâ€™s more thereâ€™s no stick â€¦hair glides effortlessly along the wand.FeaturesVersatility: Whether you choose to use a traditional curling iron or wrap hair around the barrel to use as a wand.All Hair Types: A high heat reach of up to 450 F provides beautiful results for all hair types from thin to coarse and in between.Easy Storage: Foldaway safety stand for easy storage. Enjoy free range of movement with 8ft of tangle free swivel cord.Stylists Preferred: Hot Tools heritage is rooted in the professional community. They are proud and been a trusted, stylist recommended brand since they began in 1990.Voltage: 110V. Not Dual VoltageItem 2204968How To UseHelpful Styling HintsHair should be clean and dried completely before using any styling tool.Comb out a 2-inch section of hair and place hair ends between the Barrel and Clamp. The Clamp should be on top of the hair.Using one hand to hold the Cool Tip and the other to hold the curling iron Handle, roll under for a curl and over for a flip.Leave the iron in fine hair for 5 to 8 seconds, and 10 to 15 seconds for thick hair.Press Thumb Grip to release hair.Allow curls to cool before combing or brushing.When styling is complete, slide the "on/off" switch to the "off" position. Unplug the appliance and allow it to cool before storing.Pre-caution: For External Use Only.
how_to_use: Helpful Styling HintsHair should be clean and dried completely before using any styling tool.Comb out a 2-inch section of hair and place hair ends between the Barrel and Clamp. The Clamp should be on top of the hair.Using one hand to hold the Cool Tip and the other to hold the curling iron Handle, roll under for a curl and over for a flip.Leave the iron in fine hair for 5 to 8 seconds, and 10 to 15 seconds for thick hair.Press Thumb Grip to release hair.Allow curls to cool before combing or brushing.When styling is complete, slide the "on/off" switch to the "off" position. Unplug the appliance and allow it to cool before storing.Pre-caution: For External Use Only.

reviews.headline: I returned it, its not worth the money
reviews.comments: It pulled my hair out, I tried it thinking it had a smooth barrel but it kept pulling at my hair

reviews.headline: I love this curling iron
reviews.comments:
I love that you can control the heat settings so you don't burn your hair.
I also love the size.

reviews.headline: Do not buy
reviews.comments: I loved my last hot tools after years of having it i had to buy this new white versions and after a couple weeks its not working well anymore and tome i turn to curl in my hair the light  flickers on and off and also the black coating started coming off

reviews.headline: Worst hair tool I've ever used
reviews.comments: Worst thing to ever touch my hair. Clamp rips out hair. Simultaneously fries my hair but does not create a curl. Like how is that even possible? I think Hot Tools sells a crappy version to Ulta because I've bought Hot Tools from Sallys that were great. Was expensive and did not try until after retun window closed. The only way to get a curl to last even 10 minutes is so set it in place with hair pins. But is damaging my hair so much I think it is going in the garbage.

reviews.headline: Broke after one year
reviews.comments: Didnt last long at all, the clamp completely broke after a year

reviews.headline: Broke after one year
reviews.comments: Didnt last long at all, the clamp completely broke after a year

reviews.headline: Ignore the other reviewsâ€¦.
reviews.comments:
This curling iron actually works. I will say,  it gets pretty hot so try not to go over 380 degrees! Use a good heat protectant and you will be fine. 
And yes, your curls do lasts if properly styled!!

reviews.headline: Junk
reviews.comments: Does not hold curl. Worst curling iron ive ever used.

reviews.comments:
Difficult to use. A little heavy .
But does hold a curl.

reviews.headline: Worst curling iron ever!
reviews.comments: This is the worst curler I have ever used. It heats up but the curl never stays. I do not have hard to curl hair and all it did was burn it. Returning. Do not buy!

reviews.headline: Horrible quality
reviews.comments: These were junk. They did not heat up and were extremely flimsy. Im a hairstylist and bought these for myself to use at home. I returned immediately.

reviews.headline: Curls don't last
reviews.comments: This is the worst hot tools curler. Other ones are much better.

reviews.headline: Second one of this type
reviews.comments: Like the entire product.

reviews.headline: I am returning this product
reviews.comments: I love Hot Tool products normally. The only curling iron I can guarantee the barrel to get hot enough to curl my hair. I usually use the gold and black irons but thought I would try this. made my hair so staticky and did not curl my hair even on the highest setting. I will be returning this.

reviews.headline: Quality is Terrible
reviews.comments: I bought curling iron in February and the coating is coming off, pulls my hair and is leaving coating in my hair.

reviews.headline: Disappointed
reviews.comments: I have been using wands for years when I finally re-taught myself how to use a curling iron with a clamp. I purchased this one because I've always liked this brand and the barrel size was perfect. I've tried (and failed) with this iron for months thinking that maybe my hair was just changing or it was certain products that I was using, but it would NEVER ever hold a curl. Then I started reading reviews and I realized that it was the curling iron. I have a ton of hair, but ultimately the strands themselves are fine. I tried different temperatures, holding for different amounts of timeâ€¦.nothing worked. Unfortunately, I can't return it but now I'm looking for a new one.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: Seriously really easy to curl my hair now..

reviews.headline: I would buy it again.
reviews.comments: I like the extra long cord.

media.headline: Coating on barrel started wearing off after about 15 uses.
â™¡â™¡ I would buy this brand again

faceoff_positive.comments: I recently purchased this product because I wanted to start wearing my hair curly and it is ceramic plated.  Well I love it! It has the temperature gauge so you can choose how hot you want it, which is great bc I watch how much heat I put in my hair.  I also like the fact that it doesn't snag my hair and it heats up fast...i would recommend this product.
faceoff_positive.headline: Love It!

faceoff_negative.comments: As a "higher end" curling iron I expected a little more from this product than I received.  It definitely works just fine but it is heavier than most irons I have used in the past and the disproportionately skinny handle makes it awkward to hold.  The clip is very strong but the overall design increases the likelihood that hair gets caught in the area where the clip attaches to the iron itself.  Also when hot, the iron gives off a kind of "sour" smell.  I originally thought it was just because the product was new but after using it for over a week now i noticed the smell is not lessening.  So while I would still recommend this product because it is good quality, I say...for the money shop around a little before you make your decision.
faceoff_negative.headline: Good iron with some minor issues
